attributes.action: Give support to self employed who will have their first tax return in April 2020
attributes.additional_details: A lot of people who have recently become self employed will be struggling the next two or three months if they're not to be given the same support as the others. As a new self employed I can't claim anything else rather than Universal Credit and that doesn't cover not even one third of my expenses. It's three of us from the same house currently in the same situation, leaving only one person from house being able to work as a key worker and trying to support everyone else. I believe we aren't the only ones across the UK.
attributes.background: People who have recently become self employed might not have a tax return from 2018-2019, so why not give them the chance to apply with the returns from 2019-2020.

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310471

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 
www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here:
https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/ 

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak. 
 
Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
 
Read letters asking further questions of Government Ministers: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/
